mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: "The four homes of Bottomley Crescent were designed by Jaquelin Robertson, former Dean of the University of Virginia's School of Architecture and the country's foremost Georgian architect. The Crescent is unique in both its scope and meticulous attention to detail. Inspired by Bottomley's work in Richmond, Virginia, future generations will come to view The Crescent as a model for gracious living and a metaphor for all that New Albany represents." -- text of informational sign [work]

housing complexes
